com.swirl

Class Swirl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swirl.Swirl

  • public class Swirl
extends java.lang.Object
    The Swirl class is the main entry point into the Swirl Proximity Library for delivery of proximity and content events to your app.

    You use a singleton instance of this class to start: and stop proximity detection and delivery of proximity events. It supports a listener interface so you can add one or many listener objects to receive callbacks from any of the events broadcast on the eventBus.

    See Also:
    SwirlListener

      A subclass of Receiver for location related events.
      static class  Swirl.Receiver
      Base class for all BroadcastReceivers.
      static class  Swirl.Service
      This service class presents a STICKY service which runs in the background after the application has been terminated or has no visible activities in the foreground.
      static class  Swirl.StatusChangedEvent
      Event sent when Swirl status changes.

      If this bit is set, Location Services are authorized.

      If this bit is set, Network Services are available.

      This value indicates that the system is not running.

      If this bit is set, Notifications are enabled.
      static int STATUS_PENDING
      If this bit is set, the system is transitioning from Stopped to Running or the reverse.
      static int STATUS_RUNNING
      If this bit is set, the system is either Running or if Pending is also set, Stopping.
      static int STATUS_SWIRL_MASK
      A bit mask for accessing Swirl status portion

      • getInstance

        public static Swirl getInstance()
        Return the shared singleton, assuming it has already been created. This flavor of the API will not create the shared instance if it does not already exist.
        Returns:
        Swirl singleton or null if not already created.

      • getInstance

        public static Swirl getInstance(android.content.Context c)
        Return the shared singleton, assuming it has already been created. If the instance has not yet been created, it will be created with default parameters (ie. all standard listeners).
        Parameters:
        c - Application context
        Returns:
        Swirl singleton

      • getInstance

        public static Swirl getInstance(android.content.Context c,
                                java.lang.Class[] listeners,
                                java.lang.String prefix)
        Return the shared singleton, assuming it has already been created. If the instance has not yet been created, it will be created with default parameters (ie. all standard listeners).
        Parameters:
        c - Application context
        listeners - An array of listener classes.
        prefix - a package prefix, default is 'com.swirl'
        Returns:
        Swirl singleton

      • setOptions

        public Swirl setOptions(android.os.Bundle options)
        Pushes a bundle of property value pairs into Settings.
        Parameters:
        options - A Bundle containing property, value pairs of system settings or settings that can be used by custom listeners or managers.
        Returns:
        Swirl (so calls can be chained)

      • setBackgroundMode

        public Swirl setBackgroundMode(boolean background)
        Sets the current operating mode to foreground or background. Background and foreground monitoring enables the library to take different actions based on this state like post notifications when in background, but starting Activities for content when the application is in the foreground. This mode also controls different sets of parameters for the various managers.
        Parameters:
        background - A boolean value indicating which mode to be in.
        Returns:
        Swirl (so calls can be chained)

      • addListener

        public Swirl addListener(java.lang.Object listener)
        Add a listener to the internal listener bus. Listeners are added to the internal multicast listener bus and can receive messages from any of the listed interfaces (@see #SwirlListener). Listeners added via this method are added using the mainLoopExecutor. This function simply calls addListener(Object,Executor) with the result of **executor** as the executor argument. If the existing listener has already been added, this function takes no action.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object to receive listener callbacks. This parameter must not be `null`.
        Returns:
        Swirl instance (so calls can be chained)
        See Also:
        removeListener(Object), addListener(Object, Executor)

      • addListener

        public Swirl addListener(java.lang.Object listener,
                         java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Add a listener to the internal listener bus, specifying an executor. Listeners are added to the internal multicast listener bus and can receive messages from any of the listed interfaces (see x). All messages dispatched to this listener will be delivered on the executor specified. If the existing listener has already been added, this function takes no action.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object to receive listener callbacks. This parameter must not be `null`.
        executor - The executor on which messages should be delivered. This parameter must not be `null`.
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance
        See Also:
        removeListener(Object), addListener(Object)

      • removeListener

        public Swirl removeListener(java.lang.Object listener)
        Remove a listener that had been previously added via addListener(). If the listener is not present, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object to receive listener callbacks. This parameter must not be `null`.
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance
        See Also:
        addListener(Object), addListener(Object, Executor)

      • findListener

        public java.lang.Object findListener(java.lang.Class aclass)
        Find the first registered listener of a given class.
        Parameters:
        aclass - Class of the listener to find
        Returns:
        a listener of the given class or null if not found

        public android.location.Location getLocation()

        The libraries internal OS location object.

      • permissionsChanged

        public void permissionsChanged()
        Informs the SDK that the user has changed permissions and to re-initialize things that depend on dynamic permissions

      • stop

        public Swirl stop()
        Stops the sdk. If there are pending events, they are flushed and this method will block until all queued events have been sent.
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance

      • post

        public Swirl post(java.lang.Object object)
        Post an object to the internal message bus.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to post
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance

        Log event to the log stream.
        Parameters:
        event - The event name (see the list of known events)
        data - The data for event (see the list of events)
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance

      • reset

        public Swirl reset()
        Removes all locally stored data and state. If the sdk is currently running, it will call stop first. After calling this function, the sdk will be in a stopped state.
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance
